captions.text: Well everyone: it's that horrible time of year again
where the weather gets extremely cold.
It's about negative 10 or negative 12 in our little apartment
and we are absolutely freezing.  My fingers are like totally numb.
But fear not!  There are many methods for keeping warm while in Korea!
In fact, I'm modelling the first version: animal hoods.
Aren't I just adorable in my giraffe, bunny, bear hoodie?
roar
I don't…Simon, what am I?  Giraffe?
LAME.  [ANYWAYS!]
You don't just want a fuzzy shirt.  You gotta go for the fuzzy pants as well.
The fuzzy pants are very cheap.  Usually like, man won
which is like 10 bucks.  You can get them off the street from any ajumma.
Don't want just pants?  Why not go for fuzzy socks?
That's right!  Totally in style right now.
All my students are supporting fuzzy socks with their slippers.
If you don't want to commit to a full animal look,
you can go halfway with an animal blanket.  That's right!
This is a blanket designed to wrap around my neck like a cape.
It has a hood on it.  My students actually wear these all the time.
So I can just put this on and then, very gracefully,
tie this around my neck like so
Not a full commitment, but, adorable commitment, I must say.
You don't want to go for a full fuzzy animal look?
That's ok.  You can go for something more sophisticated
Perhaps you want a bobble hat!  Extremely hot right now in Korea!
The bobble hat will keep you warm, while keeping you cool looking.
Don't want to screw up your hair?  Understandable.
Why not go for some earmuffs.  Very trendy in Korea right now as well.
These are my Pororo earmuffs.  I happen to like him.
Oh!  I feel toastier already.
Don't want to mess up your hair, or don't want to wear a hat in any way?
Alright!  That's ok.  Why not go for a scarf?
But not any kind of scarf!  A tube scarf!
These are extremely hot right now in Korea.
Um.  This one took me a while to figure out how to use.
I'm gonna put it on…
And then I'm gonna twist it…
*singing some Homestar Runner.  Represent!*
Ugghh!
Most excellent!
Don't want to wear anything like this?  Just discreet warmth?
I understand.  Well, why not go for a hot pack?
Hot packs come in many shapes and sizes.  This is the boring one.
This is just a sand bag and you have to shake it to warm it up
*awkward silence is awkward*
Inappropriate.
I'm gonna go for a different version of the hot pack.
This is the cute hot pack version.  Less inappropriate.
LOOK AT HOW CUTE THAT IS!
If I flip it over, it's got liquid inside and you just snap this metal…thing
and it reacts with the unicorn juice.  It's magical.
and the unicorn juice heats up and becomes, like, solid.
This is actually really, really hot.
Hotter than that weird sand bag.
And once it's finished it's ice cold and you can throw it at someone for self defence.
Adorable!
Don't want to use a hot pack?  That's alright.
I've got the best option for you: a Spudgy.
A Spudgy is the warmest, softest, chookiest little thing you're ever gonna find.
The downside is that he smells a little bit bad, don't you mister?
That's ok, because he's so warm and snuggly.
Hoho!  I'm so warm!
How are you doing over there, Simon?
Freezin your butt off behind the camera?
I've got my chest hair to keep me warm.
Yeah, you've got your Wolverine chest hair [like a man!]
Like a man!
[music]

title: How to Stay Warm in Korea
